name: MutationEntry
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
MutationEntry
description:
MutationEntry

MutationEntry is a chainable structure, which holds data for diffrent type of mutations. MutationEntry is used in following data operations

  • Mutate row. See Google::Cloud::Bigtable::Table#mutate_row
  • Mutate rows. See Google::Cloud::Bigtable::Table#mutate_rows
  • Check and mutate row using a predicate. see Google::Cloud::Bigtable::Table#check_and_mutate_row

examples.code:
entry = Google::Cloud::Bigtable::MutationEntry.new("user-1")
entry.set_cell(
  "cf1", "fiel01", "XYZ", timestamp: Time.now.to_i * 1000
).delete_cells(
  "cf2",
  "field02",
  timestamp_from: (Time.now.to_i - 1800) * 1000,
  timestamp_to: (Time.now.to_i * 1000)
).delete_from_family("cf3").delete_from_row

examples.caption: Using table
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigtable"

bigtable = Google::Cloud::Bigtable.new
table = bigtable.table("my-instance", "my-table")

entry = table.new_mutation_entry("user-1")
entry.set_cell(
  "cf1", "fiel01", "XYZ", timestamp: Time.now.to_i * 1000
)

params.name: value
params.description: the value to set the attribute row_key to.

methods.name: set_cell
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
MutationEntry#set_cell
methods.description:
Add SetCell mutation to list of mutations.

A Mutation which sets the value of the specified cell.

examples.caption: With timestamp
examples.code:
entry = Google::Cloud::Bigtable::MutationEntry.new("user-1")
entry.set_cell(
  "cf-1",
  "field-1",
  "XYZ"
  timestamp: Time.now.to_i * 1000 # Time stamp in millis seconds.
)

params.name: family
params.description: Table column family name. The name of the family into which new data should be written. Must match [-_.a-zA-Z0-9]+

params.name: qualifier
params.description:
Column qualifier name.
The qualifier of the column into which new data should be written.
Can be any byte string, including the empty string.

params.name: value
params.description:
Cell value data.
The value to be written into the specified cell.

params.name: timestamp
params.description:
Timestamp value.
The timestamp of the cell into which new data should be written.
Use -1 for current Bigtable server time.
Otherwise, the client should set this value itself, noting that the
default value is a timestamp of zero if the field is left unspecified.
Values must match the granularity of the table (e.g. micros, millis).

methods.name: delete_cells
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
MutationEntry#delete_cells
methods.description:
Add DeleteFromColumn entry to list of mutations.

A Mutation which deletes cells from the specified column, optionally restricting the deletions to a given timestamp range.

params.name: family
params.description: Table column family name. The name of the family from which cells should be deleted. Must match [-_.a-zA-Z0-9]+

params.name: qualifier
params.description:
Column qualifier name.
The qualifier of the column from which cells should be deleted.
Can be any byte string, including the empty string.

params.name: timestamp_from
params.description:
Timestamp lower bound. Optional.
The range of timestamps within which cells should be deleted.

params.name: timestamp_to
params.description:
Timestamp upper bound. Optional.
The range of timestamps within which cells should be deleted.

methods.name: delete_from_family
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
MutationEntry#delete_from_family
methods.description:
Add DeleteFromFamily to list of mutations.

A Mutation which deletes all cells from the specified column family.

params.name: family
params.description: Table column family name. The name of the family from which cells should be deleted. Must match [-_.a-zA-Z0-9]+

methods.name: delete_from_row
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
MutationEntry#delete_from_row
methods.description:
Add DeleteFromRow entry to list of mutations

A Mutation which deletes all cells from the containing row.

methods.name: retryable?
title: Google
Cloud
Bigtable
MutationEntry#retryable?
methods.description: Mutation entry is retryable or not based on set_cell value.
